/3-Fold-Refuges-Triple-Gem/Buddha.title: Buddha
/3-Fold-Refuges-Triple-Gem/Buddha.content:
1.  Accomplished (_arahaṃ_)
2. Fully enlightened (_sammā-sambuddho_)
3.  Perfect in true knowledge and conduct (_vijjā-caraṇa sampanno_)
4.  Sublime (_sugato_)
5.  Knower of the worlds (_lokavidū_)
6.  Incomparable leader of persons to be tamed (_anuttaro purisa-damma-sārathi_)
7. Teacher of devas and humans (_satthā deva-manussānaṃ_)
8. The Enlightened One (_buddho_)
9. The Blessed One (_bhagavā_)

/4-Noble-Truths/4-Noble-Truth.title: 4 Noble Truths
/4-Noble-Truths/4-Noble-Truth.content:
1. [Suffering](4%20Noble%20Truths/Suffering.md) – To Be Understood
2. [Origin](4%20Noble%20Truths/Origin.md) of Suffering – To Be Abandoned
3. [Cessation](4%20Noble%20Truths/Cessation.md) of Suffering – To Be Realised
4. [8-Fold Path](4%20Noble%20Truths/8-Fold%20Path.md) to the Cessation of Suffering – To Be Develop


> “Bhikkhus, those for whom you have compassion and who think you should be heeded—whether friends or colleagues, relatives or kinsmen— these you should exhort, settle, and establish for making the breakthrough to the Four Noble Truths as they really are.
> “What four? The noble truth of **suffering**, the noble truth of **the origin of suffering**, the noble truth of **the cessation of suffering**, the noble truth of **the way leading to the cessation of suffering**."
> – SN 56.26

/4-Noble-Truths/8-Fold-Path.title: 8-Fold Noble Path
/4-Noble-Truths/8-Fold-Path.content:
The **Noble 8-Fold Path** is composed of :

1. [Right View](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20View.md)
2. [Right Intention](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Intention.md)
3. [Right Speech](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Speech.md)
4. [Right Action](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Action.md)
5. [Right Livelyhood](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Livelyhood.md)
6. [Right Effort](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Effort.md)
7. [Right Mindfulness](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Mindfulness.md)
8. [Right Concentration](8-Fold%20Path/Right%20Concentration.md)

/4-Noble-Truths/Suffering.title: Suffering
/4-Noble-Truths/Suffering.content:
Clinging to the [5 Aggragates](5%20Aggragates/5%20Aggragates.md)

>“Now this, bhikkhus, is the noble truth of suffering: birth is suffering, aging is suffering, illness is suffering, death is suffering; union with what is displeasing is suffering; separation from what is pleasing is suffering; not to get what one wants is suffering; in brief, the five aggregates subject to clinging are suffering.
>
>–SN 56.11

/4-Sights/4-Sights.title: 4 Sights
/4-Sights/4-Sights.content:
1. Old man
2. Sick man
3. Dead man
4. Ascetic/Monk

/8-Fold-Path/Right-View.title: Right View
/8-Fold-Path/Right-View.content:
**Right view** is understanding of :

1. Kamma
2. Rebirt
3. [4 Noble Truth](4%20Noble%20Truths/4%20Noble%20Truth.md)
